adding.name: splice
adding.desc: The splice() method changes the contents of an array by removing or replacing existing elements and/or adding new elements in place.

adding.name: unshift
adding.shortDesc: add elements to the beginning of an array
adding.desc: The unshift() method adds one or more elements to the beginning of an array and returns the new length of the array.

adding.name: push
adding.shortDesc: add elements to the end of an array
adding.desc: The push() method adds one or more elements to the end of an array and returns the new length of the array..

deleting.name: pop
deleting.desc: The pop() method removes the last element from an array and returns that element. This method changes the length of the array.

deleting.name: slice
deleting.desc: The slice() method returns a shallow copy of a portion of an array into a new array object selected from start to end (end not included) where start and end represent the index of items in that array.

deleting.name: shift
deleting.desc: The shift() method removes the first element from an array and returns that removed element. This method changes the length of the array.

iterate.name: map
iterate.shortDesc: Creates a new array from a function call
iterate.desc: The map() method creates a new array populated with the results of calling a provided function on every element in the calling array.

iterate.name: forEach
iterate.desc: The forEach() method executes a provided function once for each array element.

iterate.name: reduce
iterate.shortDesc: Reduce an array to a single value
iterate.desc: The reduce() method executes a reducer function (that you provide) on each element of the array, resulting in single output value.
iterate.example:
const euros = [29.76, 41.85, 46.5];
const sum = euros.reduce((total, amount) => total + amount);

iterate.name: reduceRight
iterate.shortDesc: Reduce an array to a value, in reverse
iterate.desc: Apply a function against an accumulator and each value of the array (from right-to-left) as to reduce it to a single value.
iterate.example:
const arr = ['1', '2', '3', '4', '5'];
total1 = arr.reduceRight((prev, cur) => prev + cur)
console.log(total1);

find.name: find
find.shortDesc: Find an item in an array
find.desc: The find() method returns the value of the first element in the provided array that satisfies the provided testing function.  If no values satisfy the testing function, undefined is returned.

find.name: filter
find.shortDesc: Filter for a set of values
find.desc: The filter() method creates a new array with all elements that pass the test implemented by the provided function.

find.name: findIndex
find.shortDesc: Find the index of an item
find.desc: The findIndex() method returns the index of the first element in the array that satisfies the provided testing function.

find.name: lastIndexOf
find.shortDesc: Find the last index of an item
find.desc: Returns the last (greatest) index of an element within the array equal to the specified value, or -1 if none is found.

concatenate.name: spread
concatenate.shortDesc: spread an array into another array
concatenate.desc: The find() method returns the value of the first element in the provided array that satisfies the provided testing function.  If no values satisfy the testing function, undefined is returned.

concatenate.name: concat
concatenate.shortDesc: add an array to another array
concatenate.desc: The concat() method is used to merge two or more arrays. This method does not change the existing arrays, but instead returns a new array.
